alert.note: Alert for Falls (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 13 at 2:25AM CDT until May 13 at 3:00AM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Texas, including the following counties, Bell, Falls, Hill, Limestone, McLennan, Milam and Robertson. * WHEN...Until 530 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will likely cause urban and small stream flooding. Low lying and/or poor drainage areas will experience minor flooding in the advisory area. Up to 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Waco, Temple, Belton, Hewitt, Robinson, Bellmead, Hillsboro, Woodway, Lacy-Lakeview, Marlin, Rockdale, Cameron, McGregor, Hearne, West, Mart, Whitney, Beverly Hills, Little River- Academy and Lorena.
